A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I'm so utterly disappointed by this film.

Objectively\, if I had been watching this movie from nearly clean slate\, which is\, I understand\, the way Rian Johnson wrote and directed it\, then it would probably be pretty good.  Cinematically it's pretty.  Pacing wise it is strong.  Rian can make a decent movie.  That's not the problem.
The problem is\, Rian\, this is bloody STAR WARS!  No-one goes to a STAR WARS with a clean slate.  You go in wanting to be drawn back into the 'STAR WARS' space opera fantasy - and while it doesn't have to exactly follow the latest in astrophysics it still needs to MAKE SENSE based on what has come before.  It needs to be internally consistent - like any good story.  Both in character and physics.
Clearly Rian said 'I want this part to FEEL a certain way' but instead of taking the time to generate a situation like that within the context of Star Wars he just snapped his fingers and said 'this is how it is...'  So if a viewer knows or cares about how Star Wars works - how certain characters are\, what the conceits of the settings science are\, or basically if you ever ask yourself a trivial question like 'well\, why dodn't you just launch some bombers\, you muppets?' your suspension of disbelief and enjoyment is just completely shattered.
